event_note: Thermal drift on eutectic bonder — stage heater PID oscillation. Thermocouple replaced at 03:30 but drift continued. Vendor escalation at 06:00. Full recalibration required before resume.
Flip chip placer alignment offset X/Y delta exceeding 8µm spec. Vision system recal performed at shift start but offset persisted. Switched to backup substrate lot.
Substrate warpage bow 180µm exceeding 150µm spec. Third consecutive lot affected. Mold compound lot MC-2024-0887 suspected. Downstream lots held pending investigation.
Probe card contact failure channels 34 through 41 open circuit. Card replaced. Bent probe pins on P-7734 confirmed. Root cause of pin damage under investigation.
Reflow oven zone 4 heating element degraded — temperature deviation plus minus 8°C. Emergency replacement sourced from K6 spare inventory. 12.5hr downtime impact on mobile AP line.
Vacuum loss on die attach head — pick rate dropped to 60% of nominal. Vacuum generator internal seal failure on 7yr old unit. Production resumed at 85% throughput pending full replacement.
Underfill void detected via X-ray — 4 voids exceeding 100µm in die corner region. Dispense pattern adjusted. Surface contamination suspected. Plasma clean extension under review. 18 units scrapped.
Substrate warpage bow 172µm — confirmed same mold compound lot MC-2024-0887 as K5 incidents. Lot quarantined globally. Systemic issue confirmed — procurement notified.
Wire bonder alignment drift — loop height variance 15% above UCL. Capillary replaced. Realignment extended due to new substrate design. Process engineering notified.
Thermal drift in plasma chamber — chuck temperature cycling plus minus 6°C. Identical fault to K5 INC-001. Chuck cooling failure. Parts ordered from same vendor. 10.75hr downtime confirmed.
Bump height out of spec — 12% of measured bumps below 180µm minimum. Solder paste lot changed 2 days prior. Stencil aperture normal. Paste rheology testing initiated. 340 units in quarantine.
Visual inspection pass rate 81.3% vs 94% target. Upstream wafer saw street width deviation confirmed. Blade wear root cause. All WLP lots from this blade set quarantined. Blade replaced.
Flip chip alignment offset — third occurrence this week on same tool. PM overdue by 45 days. Temporary fix applied. Formal PM scheduled for weekend. Tool flagged for priority maintenance.
Warpage excursion — mold compound lot MC-2024-0887 confirmed at P1. Third factory affected. 8 pallets in P1 inventory quarantined. Procurement escalation actively in progress.
Chuck temperature sensor failure on wafer saw. Emergency replacement at 01:00. Dicing resumed at 60% feed rate. Full throughput recovery at 04:00. 14 wafers affected by positional error.
Probe card contact failure — 16 channels degraded. Card P-7891 replaced. Second probe failure in 2 weeks on this handler. Socket inspection scheduled. 420 units retested successfully.
Vacuum loss on die attach — intermittent pressure drops causing misplacements. Vacuum line cracked at elbow fitting. 12.5hr downtime. 380 units in quarantine for placement verification.
Flux nozzle clog — dispense volume CV exceeding 15% triggering auto-stop. Nozzle replaced. Dried flux in tip from prior shift. Cleaning procedure updated to include shift-end purge.
Reflow oven zone 3 undershoot 12°C below target. Same EQ-THERM-01 fault as K5 and J1. Heating element replaced. Pattern confirmed across 4 factories — fleet-wide investigation initiated.
Underfill void — corner void pattern matches K6 INC-007. Same underfill material lot UI-2024-1102 confirmed. Lot under investigation. Cross-site process engineering call initiated.
Chuck temperature deviation — eWLB dicing street damage detected. 22 wafers with street damage. Coolant flow restriction in chuck manifold confirmed. Manifold flushed. Production resumed.
2.5D interposer placement offset 11µm X 4µm Y — exceeds 5µm spec. Vision system fiducial recognition rate 78% on new substrate design. Pattern recognition model retrain required.
eWLB fan-out redistribution layer delamination — 34 units affected. Adhesion promoter application step under review. Material traceability initiated on prior wafer surface prep lot.

Substrate warpage — mold compound lot MC-2024-0887 fourth factory confirmation. 12 pallets at PH1 quarantined. Full global quarantine now in effect. Emergency procurement of alternate compound initiated.

Wire bonder thermal drift — bond force CV increased to 8% from 2% baseline. Thermal model recalibration required. Temporary process window widening approved. Fifth EQ-THERM-01 event globally in 72hrs.
Vacuum loss in plasma chamber — process pressure unstable. Chamber pump bearing failure. Pump replaced from spare inventory. 3.25hr downtime. Preceding lots verified via contact angle measurement.
PoP electrical test pass rate 78% vs 92% target. Warpage from mold compound issue causing socket contact failures during test. Downstream yield impact of global MC-2024-0887 incident confirmed.

Alignment offset on flip chip placer — recurring X-axis drift. Fourth alignment event on PT1-03 in 30 days. Linear encoder wear pattern confirmed. Encoder replacement scheduled. Temporary manual offset correction applied.

Multi-zone reflow oven profile deviation — zones 2 and 5 simultaneously drifted. Common PSU suspected and confirmed. PSU replaced but full requalification required. 13.5hr downtime. Sixth EQ-THERM-01 globally.

Underfill void — corner void pattern consistent with K6 and V1 events. Underfill material lot UI-2024-1102 now confirmed across 3 factories. Full lot quarantine issued. Supplier quality notification filed.

Vacuum fitting on pick head found loose — new 2.5D assembly cell installation issue. Retorqued and leak-tested. Preventive inspection of all fittings performed. First production incident on this tool.
Inspection algorithm false positive rate elevated for new 2.5D substrate design. True yield estimated at 91% after recipe correction. Algorithm retrain in progress. Recipe qualification ongoing.
Chuck temperature deviation on wafer saw during first WLP production lot. Development process parameters not fully optimized for production tool. Parameter study underway. 3.25hr downtime.

Alignment drift on new flip chip tool — floor isolation mount settling in new building section. Shim adjustment performed. Structural review of new wing initiated. Known issue with recent construction.
Wafer chuck control board failure. Board replaced at 01:00. 6 wafers with positional error quarantined. OEE impact on K5 for 72hr window now critical — three major downtime events on this line.
Flux nozzle partial clog — dispense weight variation 12%. New flux formulation has higher viscosity than previous lot. Second nozzle event at K6 in 5 days. Nozzle size review required.

Underfill void — lot UI-2024-1102 confirmed at J1. Fourth factory affected by this material lot. K6 V1 PT1 J1 all confirmed. Supplier placed on corrective action. Full lot recall across all sites issued.

Seventh EQ-THERM-01 occurrence across global fleet in 72hrs. P1 reflow zone heating element failure. Fleet-wide thermal drift pattern confirmed. OEM engineering team engaged for global fleet inspection.

T1 consumed remaining inventory of quarantined compound MC-2024-0887 before stop notice arrived. 5 lots affected. 68% warpage out-of-spec rate on affected units. Enhanced bow measurement on all units initiated.

Coolant nozzle partially blocked on eWLB wafer saw — blade temperature rise. 3 wafers with thermal damage to dicing streets. Coolant filtration cartridge overdue for replacement. Nozzle cleaned and flow verified.
Post-recalibration production run — thermal drift resolved. Stage heater performing within spec. Yield recovery to 95.7%. Baseline reestablished after INC-001 event window.
Production resumed with alternate mold compound lot MC-2024-0901. Warpage bow measuring 98µm — well within 150µm spec. Yield recovery confirmed. MC-2024-0887 quarantine holding across all sites.
Underfill process resumed with replacement material lot UI-2024-1205. Corner void rate below 0.2% on first qualification lot. Material lot UI-2024-1102 fully recalled across all sites.
Reflow profile re-qualified after solder paste lot change. Bump height CPK at 1.42 — within spec. Paste rheology confirmed within new lot parameters. 340 quarantine units disposition complete.

Post-PM production run on FLIPCHIP-P1-06. Alignment offset resolved. X/Y delta within 3µm spec. PM overdue flag cleared. Recommending monthly PM schedule to prevent recurrence pattern observed over prior 30 days.

Post-PSU replacement requalification complete. All zones within plus minus 1.5°C of profile target. Production resumed. Automotive customer lots back on schedule. 13.5hr downtime impact being assessed for on-time delivery impact.
Full production run post-fitting inspection. 2.5D placement offset within 2.8µm X 1.9µm Y. New substrate recipe performing within spec. AZ1 ramp trajectory on track for Q2 volume targets.
Post probe card replacement — full test run nominal. All channels verified. Handler socket inspection completed and cleared. Throughput recovery to 96.5% of planned rate.

Post blade replacement — visual inspection pass rate recovered to 93.8%. New blade set qualified and running. Wafer saw street width within spec across all monitored lots. Quarantine lot disposition complete.

Post heating element replacement — reflow zone 3 temperature holding within plus minus 0.8°C of profile. Production resumed. EQ-THERM-01 fleet-wide inspection ongoing across all affected sites. V1 line cleared.
